info.title: DHL Tracking
info.description: The Shipment Tracking API provides up-to-the-minute shipment status reports. Users of this API can: Retrieve tracking information for shipments, Identify the Deutsche Post DHL (DPDHL) service provider involved with the shipment, Verify DPDHL is using the correct delivery address. This can reduce the number of misdelivered shipments.

service.description: Service (provider) used to resolve this tracking number (id).

events.description: An event in shipment delivery; also known as Milestone, Checkpoint, Status History Entry or http://schema.org/DeliveryEvent

possibleAdditionalShipmentsUrl.description: Array of URLs to potentially additional matching shipments in the other services.

countryCode.description: A short text string code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code) specifying the country.

postalCode.description: Text specifying the postal code for an address. https://gs1.org/voc/postalCode

addressLocality.description: Text specifying the name of the locality, for example a city. https://gs1.org/voc/addressLocality

streetAddress.description: The street address expressed as free form text. The street address is printed on paper as the first lines below the name. For example, the name of the street and the number in the street or the name of a building. https://www.gs1.org/voc/streetAddress

ShipmentEvent.title: Shipment Event
ShipmentEvent.description: An event in shipment delivery; also known as Milestone, Checkpoint, Status History Entry or http://schema.org/DeliveryEvent

timestamp.description: A date value in ISO 8601 format (`2017-06-21`) or a combination of date and time of day (`2017-06-21T14:07:17Z`) (see Chapter 5.4 of ISO 8601).

addressLocality.description: Text specifying the name of the locality, for example a city. https://gs1.org/voc/addressLocality

statusCode.description: Code of the event; These codes are high-level grouping statuses.

status.description: Short description of the status - title

remark.example: The shipment is pending completion of customs inspection.

nextSteps.example: The status will be updated following customs inspection.

timestamp.description: A date value in ISO 8601 format (`2017-06-21`) or a combination of date and time of day (`2017-06-21T14:07:17Z`) (see Chapter 5.4 of ISO 8601).

signatureUrl.description: **DEPRECATED**, this field is replaced by the `documentUrl` field which should be used instead.

documentUrl.description: The link to related electronic proof of delivery document.

totalNumberOfPieces.description: Total number of items or pieces in the shipment

pieceIds.description: Ids of all the items or pieces in the shipment

trackingNumber.name: trackingNumber
trackingNumber.description: The tracking number of the shipment for which to return the information.

service.name: service
service.description: Hint which service (provider) should be used to resolve the tracking number.

requesterCountryCode.name: requesterCountryCode
requesterCountryCode.description: Optional ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code represents country of the consumer of the API response. It optimizes the return of the API response.

originCountryCode.name: originCountryCode
originCountryCode.description: Optional ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code of the shipment origin to further qualify the shipment tracking number (`trackingNumber`) parameter of the request.This parameter is necessary to search for the shipment in dsc service.

recipientPostalCode.name: recipientPostalCode
recipientPostalCode.description: Postal code of the destination address to

language.name: language
language.description: ISO 639-1 2-character language code for the response.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: Pagination parameter. Offset from the start of the result set at which to retrieve the remainder of the results (if any).

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Pagination parameter. Maximal number of results to retireve.
